meanings.definition: Relating to the sounds of speech
meanings.sent1: The phonologic aspect of language helps us understand how words are pronounced.
meanings.sent2: Her phonologic skills improved after practicing speaking with a speech therapist.
meanings.sent3: The phonologic puzzle game made learning about speech sounds fun and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The phonologic harmony of the choir's voices created a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The phonologic differences between various languages can be fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of speech sounds
meanings.sent1: The phonologic research project focused on analyzing different speech sounds.
meanings.sent2: Linguists use phonologic principles to investigate the structure of speech sounds.
meanings.sent3: The phonologic experiment involved listening to various speech sounds in different languages.
meanings.sent4: The phonologic exploration of vowel sounds revealed interesting patterns.
meanings.sent5: Studying phonologic patterns helps us understand how speech sounds are produced.

meanings.definition: Involving the analysis of phonemes in language
meanings.sent1: The phonologic approach to language learning emphasizes understanding phonemes.
meanings.sent2: Teachers use phonologic strategies to help students identify different phonemes.
meanings.sent3: The phonologic challenge was to distinguish between similar-sounding phonemes.
meanings.sent4: His phonologic expertise allowed him to accurately transcribe spoken language.
meanings.sent5: The phonologic analysis revealed subtle differences in the pronunciation of phonemes.
